timeline.message: added test for toString and fixed implementation (useful for debuging...)

timeline.author: vruano

replies.bodyText: no, you need to add a / after every allele, not only the alleles with counts >1. think about 0/1, whose sortedAlleleCounts array is (0,1,1,1)....
replies.author: yfarjoun

replies.bodyText:
index is 0 and 1, count is 1 and 1. ... (index=0, count=1) ... then (index=1, count=1). count is always 1 or larger or that is my understanding....
at least in the example that you are giving count for both alleles (0 and 1) is 1 (the second number of the pair. (0, 1, 1, 1) is decomposed into (0, 1) and (1, 1)
replies.author: vruano

replies.bodyText: In any case you could leave the code as it is... just noticed this optimization opportunity near your change so I suggested the edit but it has no concern with fix, so.
replies.author: vruano
